# ICYMI highlights from the # TCSQ3 FY 18-19 results.pic.twitter.com/qrkKwUmvPr

TCS has navigated # technology change in the # digital era by investing in equipping # employees with skills on newer technologies while valuing them for their contextual knowledge - Ajoy Mukherjee, EVP & Global head, HR # TCSQ3
This quarter, we launched TCS # Pace™, offering our # customers a line of sight to success in a # Business 4.0 world - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3
We're recognized among # Sustainability Leaders in the @ DowJones Sustainability World Index - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3

Our location independent # Agile methodology and # MachineFirst™ approach have been key in helping us advance CEO-level enterprise # transformation agendas - N. Ganapathy Subramaniam, COO and Executive Director # TCSQ3

TCS Tool # VeriAbs (Verification by Abstraction and Test Generation) emerged a winner in the International Competition on # Software Verification 2019 held at # TACAS in Prague, Czech Republic - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3
# CyberSecurity services saw strong growth around managed security services, identity and # access management, and # governance risk and # compliance - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3
TCS Enterprise # Cloud enhanced its global footprint by launching centers in # Australia and # Canada - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD, TCS # TCSQ3

We remain focused on driving rigor in our # operations, generating strong # cashflow and steering # profitability back to our preferred range, while continuing to invest strongly for future growth - V Ramakrishnan, CFO, TCS # TCSQ3

TCS # Interactive saw significant offtake for digital content, # digital channels, and digital commerce services. Acquisition of @ W12Studios and winning the Red Dot design award were the other key highlights - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3

# Cognitive Business Operations saw strong growth powered by # MFDM & cognitive services. We saw strong demand across M&A, # digital infrastructure, cognitive business command center, enterprise business processes & intelligent process # automation- Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3

# Revenue growth accelerated in all the geographies compared to Q2. Growth was led by # UK (+25.1%), # Europe (+17.6%), and Asia Pacific (+12.6%). # NorthAmerica grew 8.2%, # India grew 9.7% and Latin America grew 7.6% - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3

# IoT saw strong growth and deal wins around our # digitaltwin , fleet management and # energy management solutions. @ TCS launched the Intelligent # Power Plant solution this quarter - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD, # TCSQ3

Revenue growth continued to accelerate in # BFSI (+8.6% vs +6.1% in Q2). Growth was led by # Energy & # Utilities (+18.1%), # LifeSciences & # Healthcare (+15.7%), # communications & # Media (+10.8%) and # Retail & # CPG (+10.5%) - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3

We are wrapping up #2018 with strong # revenue growth of 12.1% in the December quarter, which is the highest in 14 quarters, with continued # growth acceleration in key verticals and across all geographies - Rajesh Gopinathan, CEO & MD # TCSQ3
Q3 FY19 Net Profit at Rs.8,105 crore; up 24.1% Y-o-Y.

Here is a summary of our statement http://on.tcs.com/Statement
Our leadership status in IT industry continues to present growth opportunities for our employees.
We have consistently nurtured our in house talent and have also been the largest job creators in the country.
TCS is the leader in the Indian IT industry and has always built its organization on strong employee values.
The total involuntary attrition for the current fiscal year will be around 1%.
The corresponding involuntary attrition numbers for FY14, FY13 were 2203 and 2132 respectively.
Our involuntary attrition for the first 9 months of FY15 has been 2574 employees which represents 0.8% of total employee strength.
As an exception we are sharing specific data on the actual quantum of involuntary separations over the last 3 years.
We would like to place on record that TCS has not initiated, & is not planning to initiate, any large scale exits in any part of TCS.

CEO Chandra: But our customers make our decisions based on the realities of this environment, and we try to partner with them (2/2)
CEO Chandra: I've stayed away from the macroeconomic environment - there are other experts for this (1/2)
CEO Chandra on a question on macroecnomic impact: I would rather worry every single day on staying relevant""
CEO Chandra: Tech is changing, business models are changing. We always have to make investments ahead of the curve.
CEO Chandra: But we want the India market to grow. We've made our investments and we're committed to the market.
CEO Chandra: Ref India business, if revenue comes down, the portion of India share will come down, no other material impact on overall.
CEO Chandra: Ref pricing: We don't generalize; each client has his needs. We always see what is good for the customer, and how we execute.
CEO Chandra: I don't see a steady erosion in pricing.
CEO Chandra: + dip in pricing, I would be coming out and stating it.
CEO Chandra: Pricing basis points dips because of a lot of factors. A services mix here, a reduction there. If there is a significant +
CEO Chandra: India hasn't done well, but no concerns on Asia Pacific or any other geography.
CEO Chandra: there were three headwinds: wage bill, onboarding costs, visa costs. But we were able to mitigate it with the exchange benefits

HR Head Ajoy: We will continue to hire in the US this quarter too, as per our requirement. No change in that.

CEO Chandra: costs, including visas, onboarding costs, recruitment costs, wage bill, have impacted this quarter, but we've managed this well
CEO Chandra: ... and there are opportunities for us in that.
CEO Chandra: There are no specific negativities I will give; we should continue to partner with our clients in what is important to them

+ partner our customers with the right capabilities.

Highlights: Offshore revenues were almost flat at 50.5 %, while revenues from non-Indian GNDM centers increase to 4.5%
CFO Mahalingam: The level of currency, market volatility has only risen in the past 3 months and we are adapting our strategies accordingly.
CFO S Mahalingam: Increased op. margins significantly by taking the benefits of growth, exchange movements & strong focus on cost management
Highlights: Enterprise Solutions, Assurance and Infrastructure Services, Global Consulting growing at a fast, double-digit rate # results
Highlights: All industry sectors have shown strong growth with all sectors growing at more than double digits sequentially except Telecom
Highlights: Latin America showed significant momentum with 18.6% growth sequentially followed by India (14.8%) and Asia-Pacific (15.7%).
Highlights: among mature markets, Europe led the growth with 18.1% growth sequentially, followed by the US (13.3%) and UK (9.5%).
Highlights: Quarterly dividend of INR 3 per share
Highlights: The number of $100-million clients increases to 14 from 12
Highlights: Total number of employees at 226, 751

CFO Mahalingam: Forex gains through hedging is INR 79 crores.
CEO Chandra: In terms of pay-per-use or platform business, like Diligenta for example, we are on a multi-year journey...
CEO: Others, like retail, look at better analytics, social media, mobile, and more. It's as varied as that.
CEO Chandra: It is difficult to standardize transformational projects we are doing. Very varied across industries. Banks look at liquidity
Ajoy: We don't see pressure in hiring laterals, at this point.
CEO Chandra: We have grown 6% this quarter in BFSI. Pipeline is good. Four out of ten major deals are BFSI this quarter.
CEO Chandra: couple of deals this quarter are transformational deals. Discretionary spend is beginning to happen, ten discretionary deals.
CEO Chandra: Visa regulations keep changing. From our POV, we focus on compliance, follow process. We are getting what we need.
CEO Chandra: the major headwind in terms of wages is behind us. There is some headwind in terms of promotions this quarter. But factored in
CEO Chandra: We have closed 10 large deals this qtr. 5-6 came from North America. Others from Europe, UK, emerging. # results
HR Head Ajoy Mukherjee: All offers will be inducted in a staggered manner in the coming quarters # results
CEO Chandra: Continuing to see biz opps. Customers are getting adjusted to the operating environment. Thus the opp. We have to be nimble.

Well, with that the press conference closes. Hope you enjoyed the updates. Do let us know feedback. # results
# results HR Head Ajoy: We have an attrition rate of 14.4% overall, worldwide. This is an industry benchmark.
# results CEO Chandra: Utilization with trainees is 75.6% and without trainees is 82.4%
# results HR Head Ajoy: Variable payout for this quarter is 100%
# results CEO Chandra: Many of the new clients, are using their discretionary spend. Deal sizes are substantial, as also prospective growth
# results: CEO Chandra: the Indian market remains to be volatile; time taken to close deals is still long. India is important, strategically
# results CFO Maha: But this should even out in the long run.
# results CFO Maha: Taxation had an impact in US GAAP net profit - tax exemption due to STP has ceased, we have also moved out of STP areas
@ hemant_sathe you got the answer to that, right :-) @ libu
# results Visit www.tcs.com/investors for financial statements and other earnings related documentation.
# results CEO Chandra: Japan is a small market now, so the disaster has had no impact, either in present ops or future plans.
# results CEO Chandra: we always continue to look at inorganic options for strategic growth, but we aren't working on anything now.
# results: CEO Chandra: 3 reasons for wage hike: 1) inflation 2) competitive talent mkt 3) reward for TCSers, the reason for our performance
# results Ajoy, HR head: we have rolled out 37k offers at engineering campus. By Q4, all those who have accepted should join.
# results CEO Chandra: Our qualified pipeline for this year looks better than our qualified pipeline at the same time last year
# results CEO Chandra: Telecom has abso growth, but its share of company's revenues has come down. There are long-term opportunities, though
# results CEO Chandra: Macroeconomic situation in US is still a matter of concern; but we are positive about the opportunity that is ahead
# results CEO Chandra: major headwinds will be the wage bill and the forex impact. We've to work to overcome those by using various levers.
# results: CFO Mahalingam: In this quarter we have recruited 19,000 people; in spite of that we've maintained our margins.
# results CEO Chandra: We are preparing ourselves to respond to the demand environment; look at our hiring; & the wage hike - we're positive

CEO Chandra: However, China operations are not dependent entirely on the Japanese market. China will grow, we are focusd. But will tke time.

CEO Chandra: We are working in multiple countries in Lat Am. Our largest markets here are Mexico and Brazil. These are domestic businesses.
...boost the local economy.
CEO Chandra: We are socially conscious: we have generated employment in the US, and in some verticals, we are making investments which...
CEO Chandra: On US, in any market that has unemployment, you have opinions and views on what creates such issues.
CEO Chandra: we help them transform by unifying these systems, this makes them to have better views, cost structures, efficiencies.
... increase process efficiencies. Companies now have multiple systems - ERPs, Core Banking, etc. For us, these are opportunities.
CEO Chandra: our biz model makes companies more competitive. Eliminate wastage, shift to lower cost base, becoming more agile...
CEO Chandra: Ram has done an incredible job; hard act to repeat. He has taken us from $100m to $6 billion, and taken us global.
CEO Chandra: We have always focused on margins; we will continue to grow. We have walked away from low-margin deals.
CEO Chandra: We have a strong investment in govt, retail, eCommerce, healthcare, etc. these will start generating revenues in the next years
CEO Chandra: We have set up a component framework devp centre; we have created platforms; already have pilot platform customers.
CEO Chandra: Consulting is a different business, it takes time. We are on the right path, and we will invest further.
CEO Chandra: We will work on delivering performance, which will eventually impact our evaluation.
CEO Chandra: TCS is an extremely well recognized co: a little more investment in branding won't hurt, so we will look into that.
CEO Chandra: TCS already 8th in terms of revenue according to Bloomberg globally. We are 1% of the mkt, we will come up with a new vision.
CEO Chandra: we are going to invest in tools to empower our people: we aim to help every individual employee to realize his/her potential
CEO Chandra: We have followed organic growth strategy in Brazil, we have grown. Yet don't rule out acquisitions to fill gaps.
CEO Chandra: Indian market is in TCS' DNA. We will be investing in growth in emerging markets, including India - believe in organic growth.

... and we enable our clients to take advantage of upgrade in technologies
CEO Chandra: TCS has a strong Microsoft CoE relationship: whenever we see an opportunity in upgrade in tech stacks, we build skill sets...
CEO Chandra: Corp Affairs Minister's comments on CEO salary are not directed to any individual. I don't have any special view on that.
... in platforms or markets, but emphasis is on organic growth.

CEO N Chandra: We already have a global footprint: we will invest in business models, frameworks, services to grow organically.
CEO N Chandra: We will look at acquisitions, but if it fills any gaps and fits our strategy. Possibly Europe market, but no real steps yet.
CEO N Chandra: We will leverage our growth strategies, we will increase our pace.

Press briefing for TCS BPO closes; fingers need a time out. Hope you guys enjoyed it. Am going to chill rest of the weekend :-)
COO Chandra: Pricing pressure is across services, including # BPO; margins are lower than IT, but will get better.
COO Chandra: India # BPO marketing is interesting: digitization, processing, KPO in public and corporate sector. Platform BPO is focus.
COO Chandra: 24000 campus offers are for IT, not BPO.
COO Chandra: Pharma/LSc KPO/BPO has grown in the past three years as an Industry, and it will grow further
Chandra: TCS is looking to hire around 1500 more in India for BPO business this year
Abid: 8 customers are live on TCS Platform, 7 platforms and 14 customers. Customers take time for transition to TCS-hosted platforms.
TCS COO Chandra: We have won several full services deals across sectors in the past year, we believe more growth in this area.
TCS COO Chandra: No acquisition targets this quarter, but we continue to look
TCS COO Chandra: Took a year to develop the Platform BPO offering. Have plans to expand. Requires a lot of rigor.
VK Raman, Head, TCS BPO non-BFS verticals: leveraging on TCS IT domains; end-to-end engagements helps customers
Raj: Customer stand to get business benefits, cost savings, no significant capital investment.
Raj Agarwal, Head, TCS Platform BPO: Three major trends shaping platform BPO: focus on cost saving, regulatory requirements, and cloud/SAAS
Rahul Singh, Head BFS BPO: Last six months we have four new clients, around $700 mn aggregate worth
Abid: local language requirements through global TCS BPO delivery centers in Latin America, East Europe, China
Abid: TCS BPO making significant investments in domain-led and platform-led BPO operations
Abid: good success in Lat America, India, APAC. TCS BPO sees opportunity to cross sell to existing IT customers
Abid: We see demand across verticals, see traction in Pharma, retail, utilities, media
Abid: We have good talent in F&A and other areas; makes us equipped to meet the $3 bn in five years.
Abid: We service 100 dif customers in 50 countries; deep understanding of non-Eng, environments, laws, culture, etc in addition to US, UK
TCS BPO Head Abid Ali Neemuchwala: TCS BPO is over 11% of total revenues of TCS.
Chandra: we have built a strong BPO management team, we are set to grow in the near future. We aim to take the biz to $3 bn next five years.
Chandra: Happy that TCS BPO today is #2 player in India, among top ten in the world
Chandra: TCS BPO is part of our full services play; more briefings on other aspects of full services play soon: Infrastructure, Assurance
COO Chandra: TCS BPO business is over INR 800 crores now
Press conf on TCS BPO Strategy at Media Room, TCS House, Bombay India. Will be tweeting highlights through the next half hour or so.

COO Chandra: Margins have improved in q-o-q as well as y-o-y.
COO Chandra: we have also announced promotions
VP HR Ajoy: Net decline in employees because our gross addition is controlled. Attrition however, has not increased.
COO Chandra: Always very focused on the domestic market; both govt and corporate.
COO Chandra: Infrastructure Services has done very well, App Dev and management: also done well. Prod Engg and services are showing decline
COO Chandra: Pharma and healthcare doing very well, we do KPO as well, and a good vertical for full services play
CEO Ramadorai: Recovery is not going to happen very quickly; still more shocks will come our way. That's what we have seen on the ground.
COO Chandra: Foreign biz expenses have reduced by moving lot of operations offshore
VP HR Ajoy: We have been able to deploy trainees into projects, resulted in better net utilization over last quarter.
VP HR Ajoy: We will be controlling our recruitment based on biz needs; attrition pretty much the same since last quarter.
COO Chandra: Expect pricing pressure to continue
VP HR Ajoy: Freshers will start joining this quarter, will be staggered over the next few quarters. All offers will be honoured.
COO Chandra: Citi Acquisition: Growth has been marginal, - that is expected in such large deals. Won two clients, they are ramping up.
CFO Maha: Forex hedging loss has come down. Other income - interest, dividend have combined to give us positive other income growth this qtr
COO Chandra: Large transformational deals are ongoing, full services IT integration, BPO deals will ramp up soon
CFO Maha: recievables will be hedged 100%. That will continue.
That's COO Chandra. Regret mistake - fast fingers caused errors :-(
CEO Chandra: Cannot single out growth has been in emerging markets; it is evenly distributed between major and emerging
CEO Ramadorai: This quarter is not one-off. We are clearly focused on operational efficiency. Growth is tougher, but we have grown.
COO Chandra: Budget cuts have resulted in some large clients declining, temporary, no cause for concern
COO Chandra: Largest telecom customer in UK showing decline; decent growth in India
COO Chandra: Main verticals are BFSI, Retail, Media. We have had issues in Telecom, Manufacturing and HiTech. US has been good.
Phiroz Vandrevala, Global Head, Corp affairs: It is a weak environment, need to keep eyes and ears open: Experience certainty resonates

Chandra: Pricing pressure exists. We have to be sensible and extremely careful.
... for example an existing client could go bankrupt.
Chandra: even so, we announced several deals in last quarter. Issue is not about new deals: issue is about how you handle surprises...
Chandra: Q4 has been the worst quarter; most companies did not finalize thier discretionary budgets; but no cause for worry
Chandra: Most discretionary budgets across the board is really discretionary - customers are taking it quarter/project at a time
Chandra: no acquisition targets this year.
Chandra: our acquisition philosophy is based on building strategic capability. CGSL was an example.
Chandra: top clients (BFSI) have declined; other revenue bands have increased. We have some target clients, and going after them.
Chandra: will focus on pharma and healthcare - focus on new as well as repeat. Short term, there may be surprises in repeat biz
Chandra: There is no direct impact of govt bailout in biz from US cos so far, but we have to wait and watch
Chandra: we expect to double our $500 million revenue from India in the next three years or so
Chandra: Deal pipeline for India govt is good, but lull expected due to general elections
Chandra: we have been in govt in India for quite some time. For e.g VAT, NREGA, MCA - we won at a time when o/seas market was higher
Chandra: we have flexible delivery networks, and a value-based approach: this is important for customers esp in govt sector
... but also bidding, RFP process, etc. We have a significant edge.
Chandra: For government we have significantly invested in frameworks in India: Govt biz needs specific skill sets - not only tech...
Chandra: Non-Indians around 10k, we have significantly increased Non-Indian hire in recent years, we will continue
Chandra: Investing a lot more in training in Enterprise Apps like Oracle, SAP, web 2.0.
Chandra: we are investing significantly in training. In FY09, we have 79% utilization (excl trainees); 69% including trainees
Chandra: We will definitely increase scale of science graduates (non engg) but we will have to see how the numbers later
Chandra: recruitment will be tightened and only based on need. We added over 32k in a very tough year.
Chandra: there are no layoffs. We recruited the largest number last fiscal. This fiscal we are focusing on freshers and offers already made
Chandra: our significant presence in these markets is going to help in the current market scenario
Chandra: Emerging markets growing at double digit. Revenues tend to be volatile - engagements are more project-based, less annuity
Chandra: Application development, outsourcing and transformational - are multi year and large in size
Chandra: scale does matter; larger players have an edge
Chandra: In the current environment, customers pursue with the realities in mind - conversion is more concrete
Chandra: Deal conversions are happening across sectors; deals a year ago took longer or closed - uncertainty was not foreseen
Chandra: We have done exceedingly well in Europe: close to 40% growth. UK has currency violatility - this has had an impact
Chandra: we expect to grow in higher rates in LatAm, MEA, APAC and India in the coming years
Chandra: We're very strong in government sector in India: quite a few transformational projects with Central and State governments
Chandra: We have a good presence in utilities as well. WEBEL, Chattisgarh EB, and Gujarat: we have provided transformational solutions
Chandra: We have crossed $700 million for India. We have significant presence in BFSI, core banking, brokerage solutions (70% share)
Chandra: We've acquired critical mass in LatAm and other developing regions. We have critical mass in revenues and delivery capabilities
Chandra: our business from LatAm, Asia, MEA: 1.1 Billion USD; We have an edge over others
Chandra: clients are looking at more offshoring
Chandra: We will work closely with our customers and help them with their efficiencies
Chandra: Major markets of US, UK and Europe will continue to go through a recovery process; Fin Services shows some signs of recovery
TCS COO N Chandrasekaran: volume growth of 18% - this has been a good year given the economic circumstances
